comments:
When you try to create the a new container with the "ecf.generic.channel" ID with a new Object[0] as an argument, a stack trace is printed but the code still runs.

org.eclipse.ecf.core.sharedobject.SharedObjectAddException: Container null had exception adding shared object StringID[org.eclipse.ecf.provider.datashare.SharedObjectDatashareContainerAdapter]: java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.generic.SOConfig.makeActive(SOConfig.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.generic.SOWrapper.init(SOWrapper.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.generic.SOContainer.addSharedObjectWrapper(SOContainer.java:289)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.generic.SOContainer.addSharedObject0(SOContainer.java:264)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.generic.SOContainer.addSharedObjectAndWait(SOContainer.java:271)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.generic.SOManager.addSharedObject(SOManager.java:218)
	at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.datashare.DatashareContainerAdapter.initialize(DatashareContainerAdapter.java:45)
	[...truncated...]

The offending line is the final line before the truncation, as can be seen in DatashareContainerAdapter's initialize() method, there's a printStackTrace() call. The shared object is not actually usable because its corresponding ISharedObjectContainerConfig's containerID is null.

Created an attachment (id=53036)
Test case to illustrate the problem.

This patch also removes the org.eclipse.ecf.fileshare dependency from the MANIFEST.MF file.

I have named the package as org.eclipse.<subproject>.tests.<component>[.*], as abiding by Eclipse naming conventions [1].

[1] http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Naming_Conventions

Created an attachment (id=53037)
Patch to handle the zero-length array argument case.

I also removed the 'val == null' check since a null will never return true with a conditional instanceof check against a String.
Patches applied, fixes tested, and checked in.  Also moved existing test cased from org.eclipse.ecf.test.datashare to org.eclipse.ecf.tests.datashare.  Thanks Remy!!
closing and adding to ip log for patch
